definition: The Thirty-Six Stratagems, a Chinese essay used to illustrate a series of stratagems used in politics, war, and in civil interaction/all the possible schemes and stratagems
surname San
three/3
ten/10
six/6
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
Of the Thirty-Six Stratagems, fleeing is best./see also 三十六計|三十六计[san1 shi2 liu4 ji4]
pinyin: san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ce4

definition: see 三十六計，走為上策|三十六计，走为上策[san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ce4]
pinyin: san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ji4

definition: “Art of War”, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], written by Sun Tzu 孫子|孙子[Sun1 zi3]
see 三十六計，走為上策|三十六计，走为上策[san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ce4]
lit. to besiege 魏[Wei4] and rescue 趙|赵[Zhao4] (idiom)/fig. to relieve a besieged ally by attacking the home base of the besiegers
art of war/military strategy and tactics
there can never be too much deception in war/in war nothing is too deceitful/all's fair in war
the empty city stratagem (in which Zhuge Liang presents himself as unperturbed while making it evident that his city is undefended, hoping his adversary will suspect an ambush)/double bluff

lit. secretly crossing the Wei River 渭河[Wei4 He2] at Chencang (idiom, refers to a stratagem used by Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] in 206 BC against Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3] of Chu)/fig. to feign one thing while doing another/to cheat under cover of a diversion
see 三十六計，走為上策|三十六计，走为上策[san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ce4]
pinyin: san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ji4

definition: to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
interlocked stratagems/CL:條|条[tiao2]
In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
to catch a thief by closing his escape route (idiom)
brocade sack of miracle plans (idiom); bag of tricks/fiendishly cunning masterplan (written out by strategic genius of fiction, and given to the local commander in a brocade bag)
stratagem/scheme
to obtain safe passage to conquer the State of Guo/to borrow the resources of an ally to attack a common enemy (idiom)
